# Open Source Google Drive Organizer

> An open source AI-powered tool that automatically organizes your Google Drive files. Try it free or host it yourself.

**Website**: https://chatgoogledrive.com/

## What This App Does

Open Source Google Drive Organizer is a free, web-based productivity tool that helps users organize files in Google Drive using artificial intelligence. When you upload a file with a natural language description, the AI analyzes your description, filename, and existing folder structure to automatically place the file in the most appropriate location.

## Key Features

- **AI-Powered File Organization**: Automatically suggests and creates the best folder location for uploaded files based on natural language descriptions
- **Google Drive Integration**: Securely connects to your Google Drive via OAuth 2.0 authentication
- **Smart Folder Suggestions**: AI examines your existing folder structure to find the perfect place for each file
- **Easy File Upload**: Simple drag-and-drop or click-to-upload interface with optional description field
- **Folder Structure Viewer**: Visual tree view of your entire Google Drive folder hierarchy
- **100% Open Source**: Full source code available on GitHub for transparency and self-hosting
- **Self-Hostable**: Deploy on Railway, Vercel, or any Node.js hosting platform for complete data control

## Technical Stack

- Frontend: Vanilla JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, Vite
- Backend: Node.js, Express.js
- Authentication: Google OAuth 2.0
- AI: OpenRouter API integration
- Hosting: Railway (default), supports any Node.js platform

## Use Cases

1. **Personal File Organization**: Keep your personal Google Drive tidy without manual folder management
2. **Work Document Management**: Automatically organize work files into appropriate project folders
3. **Photo Organization**: Sort vacation photos, screenshots, and images into logical albums
4. **Research Materials**: Organize academic papers, notes, and resources by topic or project
5. **Small Team Collaboration**: Shared Drive organization for small teams

## Getting Started

1. Visit the hosted version at https://chatgoogledrive.com/
2. Click "Connect Google Drive" to authenticate securely with Google
3. Select a file to upload and optionally describe where it should go
4. The AI will automatically organize the file into the best folder

## Self-Hosting

For complete data control, you can host your own instance:

1. Clone the repository from GitHub
2. Set up environment variables (Google OAuth credentials, OpenRouter API key)
3. Deploy to Railway, Vercel, or any Node.js hosting platform
4. Configure your own Google Cloud OAuth credentials

## API Endpoints

- `GET /api/auth/status` - Check authentication status
- `POST /api/upload` - Upload file with optional organization hint
- `GET /api/folders` - Get folder structure
- `POST /api/folders` - Create new folder
- `GET /api/files/search` - Search files
- `GET /api/files/latest` - Get most recently modified file
- `POST /api/chat` - AI chat interface

## Privacy & Security

- Uses Google's official OAuth 2.0 for secure authentication
- Only requests minimum necessary Drive permissions
- No file content is stored on our servers
- Session-based authentication with secure cookies
- Open source code for full transparency
